words.meaning: 顶部 adj. 居首位的；最上面的
(C/U)练习；操练；实践; v. 练习；操练；实践 (美)

words.example: The prices vary from store to store.
He has a great sense of humor, so everyone likes talking with him.

words.meaning: 很可能发生的；有希望的
接住；捉住；赶上(车辆); 患(病); 弄清

words.example: The function of this button is to start the machine.
We got up early to watch the sunrise.
She is wearing a woolen sweater.
He is friendlier than his brother.

phrases.example: He didn’t go to bed not until he finished his homework.
The box is too heavy to carry.
There is no doubt that he will succeed.
The students are studying in the classroom.

patterns.example: There is no doubt that she can finish the task on time.

patterns.meaning: 对……感到……；在某方面处于某种状态
patterns.example: He is angry with his brother.
The box is so heavy that I can't carry it.
It was such a cold day that we stayed at home.
He is the tallest student in our class.

grammar.title: 连词
grammar.definition: 连词
grammar.structure: 句子连接词

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He stood up and left.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: I like English and math.
He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 主语
grammar.definition: 主语的含义
grammar.structure: 主语缺失问题

sub_topics.title: 主语缺失问题
sub_topics.definition: 英语句子必须有明确主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 不能用逗号连接两个完整句
必要时用it作形式主语
examples: It is important to protect nature.

grammar.title: until 的用法
grammar.definition: until 用来表示某个动作或状态持续到某一时间为止
grammar.structure: 主句 + until + 时间/句子
usage: 表示动作一直持续到某一时间
若主句是否定句，until 常表示“直到……才……”
examples: He waited until it got dark.
I didn’t realize the truth until he told me.

grammar.title: 宾语
grammar.definition: 宾语
grammar.structure: 双宾语结构

sub_topics.title: 双宾语结构
sub_topics.definition: 一个动词后接两个宾语
usage: tell, teach, give常见
examples: He taught me English.

grammar.title: 状语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作状语的从句，用来修饰主句，表示时间、条件、原因、目的、结果、让步等。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 从句，主句（从句可前可后）
usage: 时间状语从句：when, while, before, after, as soon as, until等
条件状语从句：if, unless (= if not)
原因状语从句：because, since, as
让步状语从句：although/though, even if/though
结果状语从句：so...that..., such...that...

mistakes.wrong: If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.correct: If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.explanation: 在条件状语从句中，用一般现在时表将来

mistakes.wrong: Although he is tired, but he keeps working.
mistakes.correct: Although he is tired, he keeps working.
mistakes.explanation: although和but不能同时使用

mistakes.wrong: Because I was ill, so I didn't go to school.
mistakes.correct: Because I was ill, I didn't go to school.
mistakes.explanation: because和so不能同时使用

examples: I will call you as soon as I arrive.
Unless you work hard, you won't succeed.
He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.

sub_topics.title: when + 从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: how to + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

grammar.title: 句子结构
grammar.definition: 句字结构
grammar.structure: 主语、谓语、宾语

sub_topics.title: 主语、谓语、宾语
sub_topics.definition: 句子的三大基本成分
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
examples: Students study English.
usage: 主语多为名词
谓语为动词

sub_topics.title: 主谓一致（动名词作主语视为单数）
sub_topics.definition: 动名词短语作主语看作单数
usage: 常见考点
examples: Reading books makes me happy.

sub_topics.title: 主谓宾结构
sub_topics.definition: 英语基本句型，由主语、谓语和宾语组成。
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 动词 + 宾语
usage: 表达完整意义
examples: She likes music.

sub_topics.title: 主语谓语宾语的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 英语句子的基本结构
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 陈述事实
examples: She likes music.

sub_topics.title: 谓语
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 主语-谓语-宾语基本句型
sub_topics.definition: 英语最基本的句子结构
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 多数及物动词句型
examples: She likes apples.

sub_topics.title: 句子成分分析（主谓宾）
sub_topics.definition: 分析句子中主语、谓语、宾语的结构，有助于理解句意和判断语法
sub_topics.structure: 主语（名词/动名词）+ 谓语（动词）+ 宾语（名词/从句）
usage: 判断主谓一致
分析长难句
判断句子是否完整
examples: Reading books makes people better.
主语：Reading books；谓语：makes；宾语：people better。

sub_topics.title: 主谓宾结构判断
sub_topics.definition: 判断句子中主语、谓语和宾语的基本语法结构，是理解句意和正确分析语法的基础。
sub_topics.structure: 主语（名词/代词/动名词） + 谓语（动词） + 宾语（名词/代词/从句）
usage: 判断动词形式是否正确（如第三人称单数）
判断句子是否缺少成分
用于分析从句、被动语态、疑问句等结构
examples: She likes music.（She 主语 / likes 谓语 / music 宾语）
Reading books makes people wiser.（Reading books 作主语）

sub_topics.title: 句子成分分析方法
sub_topics.definition: 通过分析句子的主语、谓语、宾语和修饰成分，理解句子结构和含义的方法。
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语 + 修饰成分
usage: 先找谓语动词
再找动词前的主语
再找动词后的宾语
最后分析定语、状语、从句等修饰成分
examples: Reading books makes people better.（Reading books 是主语）
Children who have trouble in reading need help.（who have trouble in reading 是后置定语）

grammar.title: 宾语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作宾语的从句，通常放在主句谓语动词、介词或形容词之后。
grammar.structure: 主句 + 引导词(that/wh-/if/whether) + 陈述语序
usage: that引导（可省略）：I think (that) he is right.
wh-词引导：I don't know what his name is.
if/whether引导：I wonder if/whether he will come.
注意宾语从句要用陈述语序

mistakes.wrong: I don't know where is he.
mistakes.correct: I don't know where he is.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句要用陈述语序，不用疑问语序

mistakes.wrong: He asked me that where I lived.
mistakes.correct: He asked me where I lived.
mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问词引导时不需要that

mistakes.wrong: I wonder if will he come.
mistakes.correct: I wonder if he will come.
mistakes.explanation: if引导的宾语从句要用陈述语序

examples: I believe that you can do it.
Could you tell me how I can get to the station?
I'm not sure whether it will rain tomorrow.

sub_topics.title: what + 宾语从句
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 宾语从句作宾语
sub_topics.definition: 用句子作宾语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 连词 + 从句
usage: 表达观点事实
examples: I know that he is right.

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中修饰名词或代词的从句，通常紧跟在被修饰的词（先行词）之后。
grammar.structure: 先行词 + 关系词(who/which/that/whose/where/when) + 从句
usage: who/that指人：The man who/that is talking is my father.
which/that指物：The book which/that I bought is interesting.
whose表所属：The girl whose mother is a doctor is my friend.
where指地点：This is the school where I studied.
when指时间：I still remember the day when I met you.

mistakes.wrong: The man which is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.correct: The man who/that is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是人时，用who或that，不用which

mistakes.wrong: The book who I bought is good.
mistakes.correct: The book which/that I bought is good.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是物时，用which或that，不用who

mistakes.wrong: This is the place where I visited.
mistakes.correct: This is the place which/that I visited.
mistakes.explanation: visit是及物动词，需要宾语，用which/that而非where

examples: I have a friend who can speak five languages.
The movie that we saw last night was exciting.
I'll never forget the day when I graduated.

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（that引导）
sub_topics.definition: that引导从句修饰名词
usage: that作主语或宾语
examples: The book that I like is interesting.

sub_topics.title: 名词 + 定语从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词的从句，通常放在名词后
sub_topics.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句
usage: that / who / which 等
examples: The boy who is reading is my brother.

grammar.title: 名词
grammar.definition: 名词
grammar.structure: 名词性用法判断

sub_topics.title: 名词性用法判断
sub_topics.definition: 主语的含义

grammar.title: 固定搭配辨析
grammar.definition: 指某些词语在长期使用中形成固定组合，搭配不可随意更换，需要整体记忆。
grammar.structure: 动词/形容词/名词 + 固定介词或副词
usage: 不能随意替换其中的介词或副词
意义往往不同于单个词义简单相加
常见于动词短语和习惯表达
examples: depend on
be interested in
pay attention to
have fun
in pain

grammar.title: 常用介词
grammar.definition: 用在名词、代词或动名词前，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等关系的词。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词/代词/动名词
usage: 时间：at+时刻, on+具体日期, in+年月季节长时段
地点：at+小地点, in+大地点/里面, on+表面
方式：by+交通工具/方式, with+工具/材料, in+语言/颜色
常见搭配：be good at, be interested in, look for, wait for, listen to

mistakes.wrong: I arrived at Beijing.
mistakes.correct: I arrived in Beijing.
mistakes.explanation: arrive in+大地点，arrive at+小地点

mistakes.wrong: I go to school by a bus.
mistakes.correct: I go to school by bus.
mistakes.explanation: by+交通工具中间不加冠词

mistakes.wrong: I'm looking forward to see you.
mistakes.correct: I'm looking forward to seeing you.
mistakes.explanation: look forward to后面接动名词

examples: The meeting will be held at 3 o'clock on Monday.
She goes to work by subway.
He is good at playing basketball.

sub_topics.title: 介词to和for的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: to强调动作结果指向，for强调受益对象
sub_topics.structure: be important to sb.; be good for sb.
usage: to表示方向或结果
for表示受益或用途
examples: This book is important to me.
Exercise is good for your health.

sub_topics.title: 介词后只能接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: to do中的to不是介词
examples: without water
without eating

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法（后接名词或动名词）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法
sub_topics.definition: without表示“没有”，后接名词或doing。
usage: 表示缺少某物或行为
examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She passed the exam without effort.

sub_topics.title: 介词to的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 冠词 (a/an/the)
grammar.definition: 用在名词前，说明名词所指的人或事物。分为不定冠词(a/an)、定冠词(the)和零冠词。
grammar.structure: 冠词 + (形容词) + 名词
usage: a/an用于泛指单数可数名词：a book, an apple (元音音素前用an)
the用于特指、上文提过、独一无二的事物：the sun, the book I bought
the + 形容词表示一类人：the rich (富人), the young (年轻人)
零冠词：复数名词和不可数名词泛指、球类运动、三餐、学科等

mistakes.wrong: I have a umbrella.
mistakes.correct: I have an umbrella.
mistakes.explanation: umbrella以元音音素开头，用an

mistakes.wrong: He is an university student.
mistakes.correct: He is a university student.
mistakes.explanation: university虽以u开头，但发音是辅音/ju:/，用a

mistakes.wrong: I like playing the football.
mistakes.correct: I like playing football.
mistakes.explanation: 球类运动前不加冠词

examples: I saw a dog. The dog was very cute.
The moon goes around the earth.
We should help the poor.

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.wrong: He can swims.
mistakes.correct: He can swim.
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.correct: He can't be at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: Can you speak Japanese?
You must hand in your homework on time.
You should be more careful.

grammar.title: 介词about的用法
grammar.definition: about表示“关于、有关”，用于说明话题、内容或对象。
grammar.structure: about + 名词 / 代词 / 动名词
usage: 表示谈论或涉及的主题
常与talk, think, worry, learn等动词连用
examples: We talked about the problem.
She is worried about failing the exam.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句
grammar.definition: 用yes或no回答的疑问句，通常将助动词、be动词或情态动词放在主语前。
grammar.structure: 助动词/Be动词/情态动词 + 主语 + 动词(原形) + 其他?
usage: be动词开头：Are you a student? — Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.
助动词开头：Do you like English? — Yes, I do. / No, I don't.
情态动词开头：Can you swim? — Yes, I can. / No, I can't.
回答要与问句保持一致

mistakes.wrong: Does he likes music?
mistakes.correct: Does he like music?
mistakes.explanation: does后面动词要用原形

mistakes.wrong: Are you a teacher? — Yes, you are.
mistakes.correct: Are you a teacher? — Yes, I am.
mistakes.explanation: 回答时主语要变换，you变I

mistakes.wrong: Do you can swim?
mistakes.correct: Can you swim?
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词can不能与do连用

examples: Is she your sister? — Yes, she is.
Did you finish your homework? — No, I didn't.
Will it rain tomorrow? — Maybe.

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词/系动词提前）
sub_topics.definition: 通过提前助动词或be动词构成
usage: 用于提问
examples: Do you like English?
Is he at home?

sub_topics.title: be动词与助动词的区分
sub_topics.definition: be动词本身可提前，实义动词需助动词
usage: 构成疑问或否定
examples: He is happy.
He does like English.

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（do/does/did）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成
sub_topics.definition: 将助动词或系动词提前构成疑问句。
sub_topics.structure: 助动词/系动词 + 主语 + 动词
usage: 询问信息
examples: Are you ready?
Did he come?

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：助动词/系动词提前
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：do/does/did + 主语 + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成方法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词do/does/did提前）
一般疑问句的构成规则
一般疑问句：助动词提前

grammar.title: 非谓语
grammar.definition: 非谓语
grammar.structure: 过去分词作形容词

sub_topics.title: 过去分词作形容词
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词表示被动或完成状态
usage: 修饰名词
强调状态
examples: The broken window was fixed.

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语
sub_topics.definition: to do在句中作宾语
usage: 常见于ask, want, hope等动词后
examples: She wants to learn English.

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法（完成时、被动语态、形容词）
不定式作目的状语
sub_topics.definition: 用to do表示目的
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 动词 + to do
usage: 表示“为了……”
examples: He studies hard to pass the exam.

sub_topics.title: to do与doing的区别
sub_topics.definition: to do常表示目的或将来，doing常表示已发生或习惯。
usage: 根据动词固定搭配决定
examples: I decided to go.
I enjoy reading.

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与to do的区别
sub_topics.definition: 原形用于助动词后，to do用于不定式结构。
usage: 区分句法功能
examples: You must go.
I want to go.

sub_topics.title: v-ing 作主语
sub_topics.definition: 动名词短语作主语，表示一件事。
usage: 描述行为或活动
examples: Reading books makes me happy.

grammar.title: 过去分词 (v. -ed作形容词)
grammar.definition: 由动词过去分词形式构成，可以作定语、状语、表语和宾语补足语，表示被动或完成。
grammar.structure: 动词过去分词 (规则动词加-ed，不规则动词需记忆)
usage: 作定语（表被动/完成）：the broken window = the window which was broken
作表语：I am interested in English.
作宾语补足语：I found the door locked.
作状语：Seen from the top, the city looks beautiful.

mistakes.wrong: I am very interesting in music.
mistakes.correct: I am very interested in music.
mistakes.explanation: 人作主语时用-ed形式表示感受

mistakes.wrong: I am boring.
mistakes.correct: I am bored.
mistakes.explanation: bored表示'感到无聊的'，boring表示'令人无聊的'

examples: The excited children opened their presents.
I feel tired after the long walk.
Written in English, the book is hard to understand.

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词的主要功能
sub_topics.structure: 完成时；被动语态；形容词
usage: have done
be done
修饰名词
examples: The broken window was fixed.

grammar.title: 介词短语
grammar.definition: 介词短语
grammar.structure: 介词短语作定语

sub_topics.title: 介词短语作定语
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 现在进行时
grammar.definition: 表示现在正在进行的动作，也可表示现阶段正在进行或即将发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + am/is/are + 动词-ing
usage: 表示说话时正在进行的动作：He is reading a book now.
表示现阶段正在进行的动作：She is learning French this year.
表示即将发生的动作（常用go, come, leave等）：I am leaving tomorrow.
与always连用表示赞扬或不满：He is always helping others.

mistakes.wrong: She is play the piano.
mistakes.correct: She is playing the piano.
mistakes.explanation: be动词后面要用动词的-ing形式

mistakes.wrong: I am knowing the answer.
mistakes.correct: I know the answer.
mistakes.explanation: know是状态动词，一般不用进行时

examples: They are watching TV at the moment.
Look! The baby is crying.
We are having an English class now.

sub_topics.title: 现在进行时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示正在进行或现阶段正在发生的动作
usage: 表示说话时正在发生的动作
表示现阶段持续的动作
examples: I am doing my homework.
She is studying English these days.

grammar.title: 被动语态
grammar.definition: 当主语是动作的承受者时，使用被动语态。强调动作的承受者或动作本身。
grammar.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 + (by + 动作执行者)
usage: 不知道或不必说明动作执行者：The window was broken.
强调动作承受者：The book was written by Lu Xun.
客观报道或正式场合：The meeting will be held tomorrow.
各种时态的被动：is done, was done, will be done, has been done等

mistakes.wrong: The car was repair yesterday.
mistakes.correct: The car was repaired yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: be后面要用动词的过去分词

mistakes.wrong: The book is belonged to me.
mistakes.correct: The book belongs to me.
mistakes.explanation: belong是不及物动词，没有被动语态

examples: English is spoken all over the world.
The bridge was built in 1990.
The work must be finished on time.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The room is cleaned every day.

sub_topics.title: be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成被动语态。
usage: 强调承受动作
examples: The door is closed.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调执行者
examples: The house is built.

sub_topics.title: will + be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构（be + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示主语是动作的承受者
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 (+ by...)
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
强调结果
examples: The window is broken.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示动作的承受者是主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词
usage: 强调动作的承受者
不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The window is broken.

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.correct: She is taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.
mistakes.correct: He runs faster than me.
mistakes.explanation: fast的比较级是faster，不是more fast

mistakes.wrong: This book is more better.
mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示两者之间的比较
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 主谓宾
grammar.definition: 句子的基本结构，由主语、谓语和宾语构成，是英语句子的主干。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 主语通常是名词或代词
谓语通常由动词构成
宾语是动作的承受者，通常为名词或代词
examples: She likes English.
They finished the work.

grammar.title: 主句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中能够独立成句、表达完整意义的句子。
grammar.structure: 主句 + 从句 或 从句 + 主句
usage: 主句可以单独存在
从句依附于主句，充当主句的某个成分
examples: I know that he is right.
When he arrived, we started the meeting.

grammar.title: 补语
grammar.definition: 用来补充说明主语或宾语的成分，使句意完整。
grammar.structure: 主语 + be + 表语 或 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语 + 宾语补语
usage: 表语通常位于be动词之后
宾语补语用于补充说明宾语的状态或身份
examples: She is a teacher.
We call him Tom.

grammar.title: 数词
grammar.definition: 表示数量或顺序的词。
grammar.structure: 基数词 或 序数词
usage: 基数词表示数量，如 one, two
序数词表示顺序，如 first, second
examples: There are three books on the desk.
She won first prize.

grammar.title: 并列关系
grammar.definition: 两个或多个成分在句中地位平等，互不从属。
grammar.structure: A and B / A but B / A or B
usage: 常由并列连词连接
表示并列、转折或选择等关系
examples: He likes English and math.
She is tired but happy.

grammar.title: 因果关系
grammar.definition: 表示原因与结果之间的关系。
grammar.structure: because + 从句 / so + 结果句
usage: because引导原因状语从句
so连接表示结果的分句
examples: He was late because he got up late.
It rained, so we stayed at home.

grammar.title: 条件关系
grammar.definition: 表示在某种条件下会产生某种结果。
grammar.structure: if + 从句, 主句
usage: if引导条件状语从句
主句常用一般将来时或祈使句
examples: If it rains, we will stay at home.
If you work hard, you will succeed.

grammar.title: 结果从句
grammar.definition: 表示某种原因所产生的结果的从句。
grammar.structure: so adj. that... / such n. that...
usage: so后接形容词或副词
such后接名词短语
that后接完整句子表示结果
examples: She was so tired that she fell asleep quickly.
It was such an interesting book that I read it twice.

grammar.title: 让步从句
grammar.definition: 表示让步、转折意义的从句，说明尽管有某种情况，主句的结果仍然发生。
grammar.structure: although + 从句, 主句
usage: although不能与but连用
表示与主句意思相反或出乎意料的情况
examples: Although he was tired, he kept working.
Although it is small, the room is comfortable.

grammar.title: 同位语
grammar.definition: 两个名词或名词性成分指同一个人或事物，其中一个对另一个进行补充说明。
grammar.structure: 名词 A + 名词 B
usage: A和B指同一个对象
中间不加并列连词
examples: My friend Tom is very kind.
Mr. Wang, our teacher, is strict.

grammar.title: 同位语从句
grammar.definition: 用一个从句对前面的抽象名词内容进行具体说明。
grammar.structure: 抽象名词 + that + 从句
usage: 常见名词有 fact, idea, news, doubt
that在从句中不充当成分
examples: There is no doubt that he will win.
The news that he passed the exam made us happy.

grammar.title: 适当形式
grammar.definition: 根据句子结构和语法要求，把所给词变成正确的形式。
grammar.structure: 根据时态、数、比较级或词性变化进行调整
usage: 注意单复数变化
注意比较级最高级变化
注意词性转换
examples: She is happier than before.
He runs more quickly than I do.

grammar.title: 前缀
grammar.definition: 加在单词前面的构词成分，用来改变词义。
grammar.structure: 前缀 + 单词
usage: 常见前缀有 un-, im-, ir-
多用于构成反义词
examples: happy → unhappy
possible → impossible

grammar.title: 后缀
grammar.definition: 加在单词后面的构词成分，用来改变词性或词义。
grammar.structure: 单词 + 后缀
usage: 常见形容词后缀有 -ful, -less, -ous, -y
副词常用 -ly
examples: care → careful
hope → hopeful
danger → dangerous

grammar.title: y结尾形容词变比较级规则
grammar.definition: 以辅音字母+y结尾的双音节形容词变比较级时的拼写变化规则。
grammar.structure: 形容词去y变i + er
usage: 最高级为去y变i + est
只适用于辅音字母+y结尾的词
examples: happy → happier → happiest
busy → busier → busiest

grammar.title: the 最高级. ..
grammar.definition: 表示在一定范围内“最……”的结构。
grammar.structure: the + 形容词最高级 + 名词
usage: 常与表示范围的短语连用，如 in the class
最高级前必须加the
examples: She is the best student in our class.
This is the most interesting book here.

grammar.title: 引导让步从句
grammar.definition: 尽管……（引导让步从句）
